document_data.caption: The castle of [[High Horn]].
document_data.name: West Reaches of Cormyr
document_data.mainbody: The '''West Reaches of Cormyr''' was the stark frontier lands of the realm, encompassing the [[Storm Horns]] and [[Tunlands]] west of the [[Heartlands of Cormyr|kingdom's heartlands]].
document_data.Description: The west reaches were most famously defined by the Storm Horns, a range of towering mountains studded with beautiful vales, dour forts, and isolated villages. The passes were well-patrolled, but monsters and bandits were constant dangers to travelers, and the weather could turn deadly regardless of preparations. The [[High Road (Cormyr)|High Road]] was the sole proper road through the region as it wound out of Cormyr's heartlands and into the [[Western Heartlands]].

Geography.Mountains:
* [[Lightning Peak]]
* [[Mount Shalandragar]] and [[Eastmount]], its eastern flank.
* [[Old Blind Mage Mountain]]
Geography.Valleys & Passes:
* [[Condor Pass]]{{Cite dragon/266/The Innkeeper's Secret|57}}
* [[Dark Wind Pass]], an ancient dwarven trail of [[Oghrann]] that dug through the peaks.
* [[Worg Pass]]
* [[Marshview Pass]]
* [[Valley of Broken Sky]]

Notable Locations.Settlements:
* [[Aris Castle]], the fortified home of the [[Aris (house)|Aris]] family.{{Cite interactive atlas|Cormyr}}
* [[DaRoni's Cave]], home of the famed [[gnome|gnomish]] inventor [[Nadul DaRoni]].
* [[Eagle Peak]], a fortified trade town that dealt with the locals of the [[Tunlands]] and [[Farsea Marshes]].
* [[Greatgaunt (town)|Greatgaunt]], a fortified town founded by the [[Greatgaunt]] family.
* [[High Horn]], the most famous and mighty castle in Cormyr that protected the western border.
* [[Hornshield]], a strong castle atop [[Mount Shalandragar]].
* [[Huthduth]], a fortified [[Chauntean]] monastery.
* [[Mage Keep]], a fortification between the Storm Horns and [[Dragonmere]].
* [[Old Axe]], a hamlet verging on ghost town that mined [[iron]] from the [[Old Axe (mountain)|Old Axe mountain]].
* [[Skull Crag]], a fortified village on [[Old Blind Mage Mountain]].
* [[Torrinville]], a small village deep in the mountains accessed by [[Condor Pass]].{{Cite dragon/266/The Innkeeper's Secret|60}}
* [[Wyvernhunt]], a shepherd's hamlet in the shadow of [[Wyvernhunt Keep]].
* [[Windcrag House]] on the [[Tun Shore]], estate of the [[Barelder]] family.{{Cite archive/Greenwood's Grotto/2023-05-30/The Bareldurs of Cormyr}}
Notable Locations.Landmarks & Ruins:
* [[Chonis' Temple]], a ruined site.
* The [[Crevasse of Lost Fortune]], in the southern Storm Horns.{{Cite interactive atlas|Kings Forest}}
* The [[Mine of Cursed Gold]], a mine on the western edge of the mountains.
* [[Mistinarperadnacles Hai Draco|Mistinarperadnacles' Lair]], the home of the old [[red dragon]].
* [[Spear Rock]], a shrine of [[Tempus]] near Wyvernhunt.
* The [[Temple of Eternal Death]], a site deep in the southern mountains.
* [[Wyvernhunt Keep]], a small abandoned bandit's fort above Wyvernhunt.
